newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria offers two T-bill issues for 5.5 bln levs.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria offers two T-bill issues for 5.5 bln levs.

text.p: Bulgaria's Finance Ministry will offer two T-bill issues for a total of 5.5 billion levs worth, both dated September 11, at auctions on Monday, the central bank (BNB) said.
Funds raised at the auctions will be used to cover maturity payments on previous issues due on September 11, a finance ministry official told Reuters.
One of the new issues with a total par of 2.0 billion levs is a discount one with maturity of 29 days.
The second one is a six-month floater coupon issue with a par of 3.5 billion levs. It was offered with no minimum acceptable price set in advance by the ministry, the BNB said.
Its coupon was set equal to the BNB's central interest rate (CIR) for the period to maturity. The CIR is now set at annual 108 percent.
Two issues of T-bills - a floater coupon one and a discount one - with a total par of 2.177 billion levs mature on September 11, BNB data shows.
Details of the new issues follow:
Par value 2.0 bln levs 3.5 bln levs
